column1: # KI data from Sander et al. Allosteric feedback inhibition enables robust amino acid biosynthesis
# in E. coli by enforcing enzyme overabundance. Cell. 2019.
# No annotated inhibition for L-ALPHA-ALANINE[c], L-ASPARTATE[c], GLT[c], GLN[c], GLY[c]
# Other sources are noted in _notes and often come from EcoCyc

column12: HisG, upstream KM: Klem 1993 (for HisHF reaction step), degradation KM: Dolzan 2004 https://doi.org/10.1016/j.febslet.2004.06.075
IlvA, reverse KM: LeePeng 1979 (for IlvE), upstream KM: Eisenstein 1991
DapA, ASP upstream KM: Keng 1996 (for LysC), GLT upstream KM: Cox 1996 (for ArgD)
MetA, ASP upstream KM: Chassagnole 2001 (for ThrA), CYS upstream KM: Holbrook 1990 (for MetB), degradation KM: Taylor 2003 (for MetK)
ProB, upper limit from Perez-Arellano. 2010. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jmb.2010.10.019, reverse KM: Abrahamson 1983 (for PutA)
ThrA, upstream KM: Chassagnole 2001, degradation KM: Anjem 2012 (for Tdh)
AlaC, AlaA, AvtA, SufS, IscS, reverse KM: Kim 2010 (for AlaA)
GlnA, reverse KM: Miller 1972 (for GltBD), upstream KM: Pearson 2005
GlyA, reverse KM: Hopkins 1986, upstream KM: Florio 2009
SufS, mainly just a placeholder for Selenocysteine because the model does not explicitly produce it
